intro: Hoplocryptanthus caracensis, commonly known as the Caracense cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to South America, specifically Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of red and yellow. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in shaded, moist environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
